pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: The main reason for me was moving parts with different dependencies to different files. Different maintainers have different preferences about the optimal size of a file. I have a slow laptop, so I prefer short files. Also, I'm going to expand the `ContDiff` file later.

:v: urkud can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> I think it would be cleared to change the folder name from `Inverse` to `InverseFunctionTheorem`, what do you think?

Done.

I'm merging this PR as docstring improvements can be dealt with later.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7148327256/job/19469163850)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7148327256/job/19469163937)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7148327256/job/19469164024)
Thanks for the quick response! Your explanation makes sense to me; I'm convinced.

Thanks for splitting this large file! The other day I noticed that this file was getting slow, and now you just went ahead and did the split :-)

The new grouping makes sense to me; I wonder whether
- these files need to be split already? The original file was just at 900 lines... or is the point merely that they're four to five different things, so splitting makes more sense? (I find the latter argument convincing enough.)
- the several small files pull their weight.

Or do you intend to add further material to this file, and this is just anticipatory clean-up?
Presumably, you've thought about this; please enlighten me :-)
Thanks for the quick response! Your explanation makes sense to me; I'm convinced.

This looks good!

I think it would be cleared to change the folder name from `Inverse` to `InverseFunctionTheorem`, what do you think?

bors d+

```suggestion
We also prove the usual formula for the derivative of the inverse function, assuming it exists.

```suggestion
Let `f : E → F` be a map defined on a complete vector
capitalisation :-)

```suggestion
In this file we prove that in a real vector space,
```

For the most common case, when `𝕜` is the reals, there is a more elementary proof by looking at monotonicity: [StrictMonoOn.orderIso](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Hom/Set.html#StrictMonoOn.orderIso).  Can you please say this and give the cross-reference?
How do you get local surjectivity from `HasStrictDerivAt` for reals without using the generic machinery?

The path I am thinking of (used e.g. in the construction of [Real.tanOrderIso](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/SpecialFunctions/Trigonometric/Arctan.html#Real.tanOrderIso) and [Real.expOrderIso](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/SpecialFunctions/Exp.html#Real.expOrderIso)) is to use [ContinuousOn.surjOn_of_tendsto](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/Order/IntermediateValue.html#ContinuousOn.surjOn_of_tendsto).
This needs much more than `HasStrictDerivAt` at a point. Could you please suggest a specific wording (or just push it to the branch)?

```suggestion
* taking the pointwise multiplicative inverse (i.e. `Inv.inv` or `Ring.inverse`) of a function
```

**[imports]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Calculus/Inverse): split

nodes.body:
Thanks for splitting this large file! The other day I noticed that this file was getting slow, and now you just went ahead and did the split :-)

The new grouping makes sense to me; I wonder whether
- these files need to be split already? The original file was just at 900 lines... or is the point merely that they're four to five different things, so splitting makes more sense? (I find the latter argument convincing enough.)
- the several small files pull their weight.

Or do you intend to add further material to this file, and this is just anticipatory clean-up?
Presumably, you've thought about this; please enlighten me :-)

The main reason for me was moving parts with different dependencies to different files. Different maintainers have different preferences about the optimal size of a file. I have a slow laptop, so I prefer short files. Also, I'm going to expand the `ContDiff` file later.
Thanks for the quick response! Your explanation makes sense to me; I'm convinced.

This looks good!

I think it would be cleared to change the folder name from `Inverse` to `InverseFunctionTheorem`, what do you think?

bors d+
